page.title: 17USE OF LAND IN HAYFIELD
page.content: The land in this area is mainly used for sheep farming.Not much cattle farming is carried on because of the quality of the grass. Sheep can eat short, wiry grass but cattle have to be fed long,jucy grass if they are going to give lots of milk.Arable farming is difficult because the area is so hilly.The area around Hayfield is mainly agricultural rather than industrial.It is mainly moorland which is crossed by two main roads carrying traffic to Chapel,New Mills,Birch Vale and Glossop.There is very little derelict land or abandoned houses, because people are eager to renovate any old property.Some of the land is covered by quarries,but these are now mainly disused.Hayfield has areas for recreation,but these are just outside the area we studied.
